properties.Name: Earthquake Park
properties.Comments: Learn about previous earthquakes affecting Alaska, some great views of the city, and some shorter leisurely hikes.

properties.Name: Bear Tooth Grill & Theatrepub
properties.Comments: There is a Grill (Mexican cuisine) and Theatrepub (pizza). They are seperate resteraunts, but equally as good in taste. The beer is delicious. Highly recommended.

properties.Name: Far North Bicentennial Park
properties.Comments: Excellent hiking trails from beginners to advanced. Do be wary as there are many areas where bears feed on salmon while in season.

properties.Name: Denali Flightseeing Route
properties.Comments: Once in a lifetime experience. A must for any visitor.

properties.Name: Denali Glacial Landing
properties.Comments: Once in a lifetime experience. A must for any visitor.

properties.Name: Talkeetna Roadhouse
properties.Comments: Delicious breakfast food at an extremely reasonable price. Come hungry, and expect large quantities of food on your plate.

properties.Name: Denali Park Tour
properties.Comments: Arrive later in the season to go further on the Park Road with tour buses. Note: Private vehicles can only travel 15 miles in.

properties.Name: Lynx Creek Pizza
properties.Comments: Decent pizza locale near the Denali Park entrance.

properties.Name: Denali Viewpoint South
properties.Comments: Amazing view of Denali National Park and Denali.

properties.Name: Flattop Mountain
properties.Comments: Great views of Anchorage, and an 'easy' day hike.

properties.Name: Potter Marsh Bird Sanctuary
properties.Comments: Mile 117: A wooden boardwalk winds through the marsh and across watery openings and sedges, perfect habitat for a rich variety of birds.

properties.Name: Beluga Point
properties.Comments: Mile 110: A rocky outpost jutting into the waters of Turnagain Arm. It’s named for the white whales that are often spotted from this location as they make their way up and down the inlet.

properties.Name: Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center
properties.Comments: Mile 79: See Alaskan wildlife up close! The Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center is dedicated to conservation, education, and quality animal care of Alaska’s wildlife.

properties.Name: Chair 5
properties.Comments: Amazing American cuisine (including local specialties) for a good price. Highly recommended!

properties.Name: Kenai Fjords National Park Tour
properties.Comments: Book the National Park Tour with Fox Island dinner (Wild Alaska Salmon, Prime Rib, and Alaskan King Crab).

properties.Name: Fox Island
properties.Comments: Enjoy the amazing cuisine (Wild Alaska Salmon, Prime Rib, and Alaskan King Crab), skip rocks on the beach, and enjoy the beauty around you.

properties.Name: Hive Island
properties.Comments: See countless birds species, called the hive due to the sounds heard (similar to a bee hive for birds).

properties.Name: Bear Glacier
properties.Comments: Bear Glacier is one of the premier, jaw-dropping scenic experiences on the coast of Alaska. Bear Glacier lagoon has the some of the most massive icebergs in Alaska.

properties.Name: No Name Island
properties.Comments: Check out the Steller Lions taking in the Sun's rays.

properties.Name: Holgate Glacier
properties.Comments: A tidewater and mountain glacier. It is one of the smaller glaciers in Aialik Bay, but a popular destination to hear and see glacial calving.

properties.Name: Pederson Glacier
properties.Comments: Pedersen Glacier eceded throughout the 20th century exposing Pedersen Spit and Pedersen Lagoon that includes a beautiful habitat.

properties.Name: Aialik Glacier
properties.Comments: The largest glacier in Aialik Bay, and both a tidewater and mountain glacier. While fairly stable, the glacier calves most actively in May and June.

properties.Name: Exit Glacier
properties.Comments: One of the most accessible valley glaciers in Alaska with moderately easy trails to view the glacier up close. A visible indicator of glacial recession due to anthropogenic climate change.

properties.Name: Seward Brewing Company
properties.Comments: Grab a brew (or flight) and some local fresh cuisine! Recently remodeled, and a great updated menu! Great souvenirs glasses!

properties.Name: Alaska Sealife Center
properties.Comments: Alaska’s only public aquarium and ocean wildlife rescue center. Experience close encounters with puffins, octopus, sea lions and other sealife while peeking over the shoulders of ocean scientists studying Alaska’s rich seas and diverse sealife.

properties.Name: St. Elias Brewery
properties.Comments: Local brewery with decent cuisine. The decor is... different.

properties.Name: Kay Bay Coffee
properties.Comments: BEST. COFFEE. EVER!

properties.Name: Duncan House Diner
properties.Comments: Great breakfast food served all day for a reasonable price. Cute decor!

properties.Name: Alaska Islands & Ocean Visitor Center
properties.Comments: Your window to the largest seabird refuge in the world, with all of the wonders of Kachemak Bay right outside its doors!

properties.Name: Mariner Park
properties.Comments: Cute beach park located at the start of the Homer Spit.

properties.Name: Lands End
properties.Comments: The end of Alaska Highway 1. Great views of Kachemak Bay.

properties.Name: Skyline Drive
properties.Comments: Incredible views of Kachemak Bay, Homer, and the Homer Spit.

properties.Name: The Saltry
properties.Comments: Amazing local cuisine. Order the Halibut, and Cheesecake for dessert. You won't be disappointed.

properties.Name: Lighthouse
properties.Comments: Hike to a cute lighthouse on Halibut Cove. You can also view the arch from up close!

properties.Name: Danny J Boat Cruise
properties.Comments: Take the 45-minute cruise to Halibut Cove via the Danny J. Booking will include a dinner reservation at the amazing Saltry resteraunt.

properties.Name: Halibut Cove Hiking Trail
properties.Comments: Short trail to Halibut Cove's lighthouse, great views of the Bay.

properties.Name: Salty Dawg Saloon
properties.Comments: A well-known landmark with a lot of history and tradition. Bring a dollar bill to leave your mark on the walls, and check out the USGS marker inside the front door (the only one known in a bar).

properties.Name: The Bagel Shop
properties.Comments: Super delicious fresh bagels. Get a bagel, make a sandwich, or do a schmear.

properties.Name: Homer Overlook
properties.Comments: Amazing views of Homer.

properties.Name: Anchor Point Beach
properties.Comments: Great views of the Cook Inlet volcanoes.

properties.Name: North America's Most Westerly Highway Point
properties.Comments: Check out the most Westerly locale along North America's Highway system.

properties.Name: The Transfiguration of Our Lord Russian Orthodox Church
properties.Comments: A beautiful historic Russian Orthodox church that opened in 1901.

properties.Name: Kenai Lake Overlook
properties.Comments: An unofficial overlook, there is a path that leads to an opening with amazing views of Kenai Lake.

properties.Name: Anton Anderson Memorial Tunnel
properties.Comments: The longest railroad highway tunnel in North America.

properties.Name: Bird Point and Trail
properties.Comments: Mile 99: Stunning views. Also, look for Beluga whales a few hours before high tide.

properties.Name: Alaska Zoo
properties.Comments: Lots of great local animals!

properties.Name: Scavi di Pompei
properties.Comments: Archaeological site of the remains of the iconic Roman city preserved by Vesuvius' ash.

properties.Name: Faraglioni
properties.Comments: Coastal and oceanic rock formations eroded by waves.
